ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Introduction to major trends in modern Mexican historiography, focusing on the place of "culturalist" modes of historical analysis, as well as major historiographical debates.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It contributed directly to my research, and I just consider myself fortunate to have had the opportunity to take this with Prof. Joseph.

For the final paper, I wrote a historiographical analysis of a kind of scholarship in the Mexican case that I wanted to take in for its comparative value vis a vis my own interests in a different country. Although my topic was not central to the material of the course itself, Prof. Joseph gave me the freedom to pursue a final paper that suited my own needs outside of his classroom.
